metadata.Title: CVE-2017-14265 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
A Stack-based Buffer Overflow was discovered in xtrans_interpolate ininternal/dcraw_common.cpp in LibRaw before 0.18.3. It could allow a remotedenial of service or code execution attack.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14265` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libraw-bin - 0.15.4-1ubuntu0.1
libraw9 - 0.15.4-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libraw package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.15.4-1ubuntu0.1').
ufraw: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
darktable: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
